thread.title: Shortland Street's 'Please tell me that is not your penis!' Is this the best soap cliffhanger ever? | Metro News
thread.title_full: Shortland Street's 'Please tell me that is not your penis!' Is this the best soap cliffhanger ever? | Metro News

author: Duncan Lindsay For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Shortland Street's 'Please tell me that is not your penis!' Is this the best soap cliffhanger ever? | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 11:30 am To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
New Zealand’s top soap Shortland Street is receiving a lot of global attention of late – and it’s all thanks to a pretty memorable cliffhanger in a recent episode which saw teenager Harry Warner’s dad, Chris, yell: ‘Please tell me that is not your penis!’ 
Viewers spluttered out their coffee in surprise at the unexpected line and, as the credits rolled, the clip of the dialogue was already going viral across the internet. It’s fair to say that you’d be unlikely to hear this on Coronation Street. 
For context, the actual storyline is a lot less slapstick and way more serious than the individual line would lead you to believe. As part of Harry’s story, images of his penis were shared with his girlfriend Lily and his dad Chris was horrified to find them as his phone was synced to the tablet. (Picture: TVNZ) 
But the attention for a long time was purely on Chris’ now iconic delivery of THAT line: Not a fan of Shortland Street, but "Please tell me that is not your penis" is hilarious. Hollywood take notes. 
— Jordan Beck (@BeckFiction) February 15, 2017 Home and Away can fuck off, they'll never beat that Shortland Street cliffhanger "TELL ME THIS ISN'T YOUR PENIS " 
— SEXTINA AQUAFINA (@lisalovesbacon) February 15, 2017 Shortland Street penis cliffhanger
